questions.question: My tire was flat. I learned how to fix it.

choices.answer: My tire was flat so I learned how to fix it.
My tire was flat, so I learned how to fix it.
My tire was flat and I learned how to fix it.
Correct as it is!

questions.question: I asked my father. He showed me how to do it.

choices.answer: I asked my father so he showed me how to do it.
I asked my father and he showed me how to do it.
I asked my father, and he showed me how to do it.
None of the above.

questions.question: Now the wheels are fine. The brakes don't work.

choices.answer: Now the wheels are fine, but the brakes don't work.
Now the wheels are fine but the brakes don't work.
Now the wheels are fine so the brakes don't work.
Now the wheels are fine and the brakes don't work.

questions.question: A cable is broken. A bolt is loose.

choices.answer: A cable is broken and a bolt is loose.
Correct!
A cable is broken so a bolt is loose.
A cable is broken, and a bolt is loose.

questions.question: We'll take it to the shop. They'll fix it tomorrow.

choices.answer: We'll take it to the shop, and they'll fix it tomorrow.
Well take it to the shop and they'll fix it tomorrow.
We'll take it to the shop so they'll fix to tomorrow.
None of the above.

questions.question: I like to exercise, but my brother likes to watch TV.

choices.answer: I like to exercise. My brother likes to watch TV.
I like to exercise but my brother likes to watch TV.
Correct as it is!

questions.question: What is true about compound sentences?

choices.answer: They have correlative conjunctions.
They are 2 simple sentences connected by a conjunction.
Both of them!

questions.question: Did you learn anything new about compound sentences?

choices.answer: Yes
No
